issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
I also tried to reproduce this, without success.
Solaris 10 (x86), Sun JDK 1.4.2, 1.5 and 1.6. I ran the test individually.

'derby-3465-1a-remove_try_catch.diff' removes what I think is unnecessary try-catch clauses.
If the error happens again, we might hopefully get a more helpful error message.

Test runs without errors on my system with the patch applied.
A review is very much appreciated.

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
I tried the patch and it ran cleanly on Solaris 10/x86 with Java 1.5 and 1.6.
Changes look good, no need for the test to catch these exceptions.

+1

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
Thank you for the review Dag.

The test also ran cleanly for me, and I committed 'derby-3465-1a-remove_try_catch.diff' to trunk with revision 631286.
If the test fails again, we might hopefully get some more helpful information and can investigate the problem.

I guess we just have to wait for a while before we resolve the issue.
I removed all the locale jars from the classpath and split it up, as it broke the formatting pretty bad.

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body: Please reopen if it occurs again.
